vulnerabilities.description: project.ts uses z.any() without strict validation
vulnerabilities.impact: Could allow unexpected data types leading to application errors or security issues
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Replace z.any() with specific type validations or add .strict() mode

vulnerabilities.description: route.ts may not validate file types
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement proper file type and size validation

vulnerabilities.description: route.ts POST endpoint without rate limiting
vulnerabilities.impact: Could be vulnerable to DoS attacks or abuse
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement rate limiting for API endpoints

vulnerabilities.impact: Could allow unauthorized access to API endpoints
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Add authentication checks to all protected endpoints

vulnerabilities.impact: Could expose sensitive system information to attackers
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Sanitize error messages before returning to client

vulnerabilities.description: route.ts POST endpoint without rate limiting
vulnerabilities.impact: Could be vulnerable to DoS attacks or abuse
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement rate limiting for API endpoints

vulnerabilities.impact: Could allow unauthorized access to API endpoints
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Add authentication checks to all protected endpoints

vulnerabilities.description: route.ts POST endpoint without rate limiting
vulnerabilities.impact: Could be vulnerable to DoS attacks or abuse
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement rate limiting for API endpoints

vulnerabilities.description: No explicit CSRF protection found in middleware
vulnerabilities.impact: State-changing requests could be vulnerable to CSRF attacks
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement CSRF token validation for state-changing operations

vulnerabilities.impact: Cookies could be sent in cross-site requests
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Configure SameSite=Strict or SameSite=Lax for cookies

vulnerabilities.impact: Could leave application vulnerable to various attacks
Sensitive credentials could be committed to version control
